text:
[ Angada restores courage and confidence of Vanaras who feared Kumbhakarna and were fleeing from the battlefield. Destruction of some Vanaras at the hand s of Kumbhakarna.]

स लङ्घयित्वाप्राकारंगिरिकूटोपमोमहान् ।

निर्ययौनगरात्तूर्णंकुम्भकर्णोमहाबलः ।।6.66.1।।
meaning: गिरिकूटोपमः who resembled peak of mountain, महान् gigantic, महाबलः mighty, सःकुम्भकर्ण: Kumbhakarna, प्राकारं boundary, लङ्घयित्वा having crossed, तूर्णम् swiftly, नगरात् from the city, निर्ययौ roared.
translation: Mighty Kumbhakarna, a gigantic one, resembling a mountain peak, having swiftly crossed over the boundary of the city roared.

meaning: निर्घातान् bringing out loud noise,विजयत्रि as if proclaiming victory, पर्वतान् mountains, विधमन् इव like breaking, महानादम् great sound, समुद्रम् ocean, अभिनादयन् reverberate, नादयन roared.
translation: Kumbhakarna roared making loud noises as if proclaiming victory, like the breaking of mountains and reverberating of ocean.

meaning: मघवता by Indra, यमेनby Yama, वरुणेनवा or even Varuna, अवध्यम् not be killed, भीमाक्षम् with frightening eyes, तम् him, प्रेक्ष्य observing, वानराः the Vanaras, विप्रदुद्रुवुः ran in fear.
translation: Observing that rakshasa with frightening eyes, who could not be killed by Indra or Yama or even by Varuna coming towards them the vanaras ran in fear.

text:
तांस्तुविप्रद्रुतान् दृष्टवाराजपुत्रोऽङ्गदोऽब्रवीत् ।

नलंनीलंगवाक्षं च कुमुदं च महाबलम् ।।6.66.4।।
meaning: विप्रद्रुतान् running in fear, तान् them, नलम् Nala, नीलम् Nila, गवाक्षं च and Gavaksha, महाबलम् Mahabala, कुमुदम् Kumuda, दृष्टवा seeing, राजपुत्रः prince, अङ्गदःAngada, अब्रवीत् spoke
translation: Seeing the Vanaras running in fear, Angada spoke to Nala, Nila, Gavaksha, Mahabala and Kumuda.

meaning: आत्मानम् yourself, अत्र there, वीर्याणि warriors, अभिजनानि च not knowing, विस्मृत्य forgetting, प्राकृताः by nature, हरयःयथा like the Vanaras, भयत्रस्ताः fearing, क्व where, गच्छत are you going.
translation: "Forgetting yourself, that you are warriors, not knowing by nature, being Vanaras where are you going?"

meaning: सौम्याः good, साधु modest, निवर्तध्वम् return, प्राणान् life, किम् why, परिरक्षथ protecting, रक्षः Rakshasa, युद्धाय in war, नालम् not capable facing, इयम् this, महती great, बिभीषिका who can create fear.
translation: "O good Vanaras! You are modest. Return. Why are you protecting your life? This Rakshasa is not capable of facing war. He can create only fear."

meaning: प्लवङ्गमाः Vanaras, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, उथतिताम् dispel, महतीम् huge, एनांबिभीषिकाम् this nightmare, विक्रमात् with our power, विधमिष्यामः kill them, निवर्तध्वम् come back.
translation: "O Vanaras! We will dispel this huge rakshasa, a nightmare with our power. Come back."

meaning: हरयः Vanaras, कृच्छ्रेण from distress, समाश्वस्य getting over fear, ततस्ततः from here and there, सङ्गम्य getting together, वृक्षान् trees, हस्ता by hand, रणाजिरम् to battlefield, सम्प्रतस्थुः proceeded.
translation: Overcoming fear, the Vanaras getting together from here and there holding trees by hand, proceeded to the battlefield.

meaning: ते those, वनौकसः forest rangers, निवृत्य turning back, सङ्कृद्दाः to hit, परमक्रुद्धाः extremely angry, समदाः who were determined, कुञ्चराःइव like elephants in rut, कुम्भकर्णम् at Kumbhakarna, निर्जघ्नुः to vanquish him.
translation: Those forest rangers who were extremely enraged turned back to hit, determined like the elephants in rut went to vanquish Kumbhakarna.

meaning: शुभिः lofty, गिरिशृङ्गैश्च mountain peaks, शिलाभिश्च rocks also, पुष्टिताग्रैः trees with blossoms on top tops, पादपैः trees, हन्यमानः though hit, महाबलः Kumbhakarna, न कम्पते not shaken.
translation: Though Kumbhakarna was hit with lofty mountain peaks and trees with blossoms at crests, he was not shaken.

meaning: तस्य his, गात्रेषु limbs, पतिताःfallen, बहवः many, शिलाः rocks, भिद्यन्ते were broken, पुष्पिताग्राश्च even the treetops with blossoms, पादपाः trees, भग्नाः broken, महीतले fell on the ground, पेतुः shattered.
translation: Fallen on his limbs many rocks got broken, even the treetops with blossoms were broken and fell on the ground.

meaning: सःअपि he also, सङ्क्रुद्धः enraged, परमायत्तः the great, उत्थितः burst, अग्नि: fire, वनानीव forest, महौजसाम् endowed with extraordinary vigour, वानराणाम् Vanaras, सैन्यानि army, ममन्थ to destroy.
translation: Enraged Kumbhakarna began to destroy Vanaras endowed with extraordinary vigour, just as great forest fire burns the forest.

meaning: बहवः many, वानरर्षभाः bulls among Vanaras, लोहितार्द्रा: trees with red flowers on top, निरस्ताः tossed, भूमौ on the ground, पतिताः fallen, ताम्रपुष्पाः red flowers, द्रुमाःयथा like trees lay in blood.
translation: Many bulls among the Vanaras lay on the ground like trees with red flowers on top tossed and fallen on the ground.

meaning: वानराः Vanaras, लङ्घयन्तः leaping, प्रधावन्तः flying, नावलोकयन् not turning back to see, केचित् indeed, समुद्रे ocean, पतिताः dropped, केचित् some, गगनम् space, आस्थिताः flew.
translation: The Vanaras leapt without looking back. Indeed, some dropped into the ocean, and some flew into space.

meaning: राक्षसेन by Rakshasas, लीलया struck by, वध्यमानाः struck by, तेवीराः those heroes, येनपथा by the path, सागरम् ocean, तीर्णाः crossed, पथातेन by the same path, दुद्रुवुः ran.
translation: Struck by Rakshasa, the Vanaras ran in the same path crossing the ocean (by which they came).

meaning: तदा then, भयात् out of fear, विवर्णवदनाः pale countenance, ते they, स्थलानि location, निम्नम् plains, ऋक्षाः Bears, वृक्षान् trees, समारूढाः climbed up, केचित् some, पर्वतम् mountains, आश्रिताः sought resort.
translation: Out of fear the vanaras rushed to plains with pale countenance, some climbed up mountains and bears climbed up trees.

meaning: केचित् some, अर्णवे ocean, ममज्जुः drowned, केचित् some, गुहाः caves, समाश्रिताः took shelter, अपरेकेचित् and some others, निपेतुः not knowing anything, केचित् some, नैवअवतस्थिरे sat down, केचित् some, भूमौ on the ground, निपतिताः fallen, केचित् some, मृताः इव as if deadसुप्ताः slept.
translation: Some drowned in the ocean, some entered into the caves, some others not knowing what to do sat down and others fell on the ground and some slept as if dead.

meaning: अङ्गदःAngada, भग्नान् routed, तान् them, वानरान् Vanaras, समीक्ष्य observing, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke, प्लवङ्गमाः to the monkeys, अवतिष्ठत stay, निवर्तध्वम् return, युध्यामः will fight.
translation: Seeing the monkeys routed, Angada spoke, 'Stay, return back. We will fight'

meaning: इमाम् this, महीम् globe, परिक्रम्य go round, भग्नानाम् routed, वः or, स्थानम् place, न पश्यामि not see, सर्वे all, निवर्तध्वम् return, प्राणान् life, किम् why, परिरक्षथ refuge.
translation: "I do not see any refuge for you even if you go round the globe. All of you return back. Why do you preserve life?"

meaning: असङ्गगतिपौरुषाः whose valour can't be challenged, निरायुधानाम् abandoning weapons, द्रवताम् run away, दाराः wives, उपहसिष्यन्ति will ridicule, जीवताम् life, सः for those, घातःवै indeed more than death.
translation: "Monkeys! Your valour can't be challenged. If you run away for life abandoning weapons even your wives will ridicule you. That is more than death."

meaning: सर्वे all, विस्तीर्णेषु widely spread, महत्सु च noble also, कुलेषु clan, जाताःस्म born into, प्राकृताः ordinary, हरयःयथा monkeys like, भयत्रस्ताः in fear, क्व why, गच्छत go, वीर्यम् valour, त्यक्त्वा giving up, भीताः terrified, यत् as if, प्रधावत running away, अनार्याःखलु not worthy of.
translation: "You are born in noble families, and are widely spread. As such why are you running away like ordinary monkeys as if terrified giving up your valour. It is not worthy of you."

meaning: सर्वे all, विस्तीर्णेषु widely spread, महत्सु च noble also, कुलेषु clan, जाताःस्म born into, प्राकृताः ordinary, हरयःयथा monkeys like, भयत्रस्ताः in fear, क्व why, गच्छत go, वीर्यम् valour, त्यक्त्वा giving up, भीताः terrified, यत् as if, प्रधावत running away, अनार्याःखलु not worthy of.
translation: "You are born in noble families, and are widely spread. As such why are you running away like ordinary monkeys as if terrified giving up your valour. It is not worthy of you."

meaning: यानि earlier, जनसंसदि in assembly of people, वः or else, सोदग्राणि made vigorous statements, महान्ति च acclaimed highly, यातानि such you, विकत्थनानि selfpraise, वः such you, all that, क्व where, गतानि has it gone.
translation: "Earlier in the assembly of people you made vigorous statements and acclaimed yourselves highly with selfpraise. Where has it gone?"

meaning: यः he who, धिक्कृतः having been defeated, जीवति lives, भीरोः timid, प्रवादाः will say, श्रूयन्ते will tell, सत्पुरुषैः good people, जुष्टः resorting to, मार्गः path, सेव्यताम् following, भयम् fear, त्यज्यताम् giving up.
translation: "He who is defeated lives, but people will say he is timid. Resorting to the path of good people and serving them gives up fear."

meaning: अल्पजीविताः life span is reduced, निहताः having been killed, पृथिव्याम् in the world, शयामहेवाfall, युधिसूदिता killed in war, दुष्प्रापम् difficult to attain, ब्रह्मलोकम् world of Brahma, प्राप्नुयामः च will attain.
translation: "If we are killed in war, fallen dead on the ground and our life span is reduced, we will attain the realm of Brahma which is difficult to attain."

meaning: वानराः Vanara, आहवे we will, शत्रुम् the enemy, निहत्वा killing, कीर्तिम् fame, सम्प्राप्नुयामः will attain, वा or else, जीवितः life, वीरलोकस्य in the world of Brahma, वसु will be, मोक्ष्यामः liberated.
translation: "By killing the enemy, we will attain fame. Or else we will attain the world of Brahma, liberated."

meaning: पतङ्गः fly, दीप्यमानम् reaching flame, ज्वलनम् blazing, आसाद्यइवयथा not possible to escape, कुम्भकर्णः for Kumbhakarna, काकुत्स्थम् Kakuthsa, दृष्टवा seeing, जीवन् life, न गच्छति not escape.
translation: "Just as flies reaching the blazing fire can't escape, so also Kumbhakarna can't escape with life after facing Kakuthsa."

meaning: एकेन by one, भग्नाः destroyed, बहवः though many, उददिष्टाः distinguished, वयम् we, पलायनने by running away, प्राणान् life, रक्षामहे protect, यशः glory, नाशम् gone, गमिष्यति come to an end.
translation: "Even though we are distinguished, if we preserve our life by running away for life, destroyed by one, our glory will come to an end."

meaning: द्रवमाणाः fleeing away, एवम् in that manner, ब्रुवाणम् speaking, कनकाङ्गदम् adorned with gold armlets, शूरम् to the heroes, तम् that, अङ्गदम् Angada, ततः thereafter, शूरुविगर्हितम् condemned by hero, वाक्यम् words, ऊचुः said.
translation: While the heroic Angada, adorned with gold armlets, was speaking in that manner to the fleeing vanara heroes, condemned by the hero the vanaras replied as follows.

meaning: नः us, रक्षसा Rakshasa, कुम्भकर्णेनKumbhakarna, घोरम् dreadful, कदनम् havoc, कृतम् done, स्थानकालः moment to stay, न not, नः we, जीवितम् our life, दयितंहि dear to us.
translation: "Kumbhakarna, the Rakshasa has done havoc to us. This is not the moment to stay. Our life is dear to us."

meaning: सर्वे all,एता to you. वानरयूथपाः Vanara troops, भीमाक्षम् frightful eyes, भीमम् fear, आयान्तम् coming towards, दृष्टवा seeing, एतावत् in that way, वचनम्words, उक्त्वा having spoken, दिशः directions, भेजिरे scattered.
translation: All the Vanara troops having replied that way, seeing Kumbhakarna of frightful eyes coming towards them, scattered in all directions.

meaning: द्रवमाणाः running away, वीराः heroes, ते you are, वलीमुखाः to return back, सरेततः wherever they were, अङ्गदेन by Angada, सान्त्वैश्चै with good words, अनुमानैश्च by examples, निवर्तिताः turned.
translation: Though the heroic monkeys were running away, Angada by his good words and examples turned them to return from wherever they were.

meaning: सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः Vanara troops, धीमता wise, वालिपुत्रेण Vali's son, प्रहर्षम् happily, उपनीताः च restored, आज्ञाप्रतीक्षाः awaiting command, तस्थुः च stood
translation: All the Vanara troops having heard Angada, son of Vali happily restored awaiting his command.

meaning: ऋषभशरभमैन्धधूम्रनीलाः Rshaba, Sarabha, Mainda, Dhruma and Nila, कुमुदसुषेणगवाक्षम्भताराः Kumuda, Susena, Gavaksha, Rambha, and Tara, द्विविदपनसवायुपुत्रमुख्याः Dwivida, Panasa, and Hanuman, त्वरिततराभिमुखम् marched ahead swiftly, रणम् to the battlefield, प्रयाताः quickly.
translation:
Rshaba, Sarabha, Mainda and Nila, Kumuda, Susena, Rambha, and Tara headed by Dwiviida, Panasa and Hanuman marched ahead swiftly to the battlefield.
।। इत्यार्षेवाल्मीकीयेश्रीमद्रामायणेआदिकाव्येयुद्धकाण्डेषष्टितमस्सर्गः ।।
This is the end of the sixty sixth sarga of Yuddha Kanda of the first epic, the holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
